issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Correctly populate request parameters for image registration and run instances using euca2ools

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
euca-describe-images lists only one device mapping (mostly the root device) for any image. DescribeImagesResponse from the service contains all the device mappings

{noformat}
[root@eucahost-51-167 ~]# euca-describe-images emi-0F904543 --debug
2013-01-24 15:08:35,211 euca2ools [DEBUG]:Method: POST
2013-01-24 15:08:35,211 euca2ools [DEBUG]:Path: /services/Eucalyptus/
2013-01-24 15:08:35,211 euca2ools [DEBUG]:Data: 
2013-01-24 15:08:35,211 euca2ools [DEBUG]:Headers: {}
2013-01-24 15:08:35,211 euca2ools [DEBUG]:Host: 192.168.51.167:8773
2013-01-24 15:08:35,212 euca2ools [DEBUG]:establishing HTTP connection: kwargs={}
2013-01-24 15:08:35,212 euca2ools [DEBUG]:Token: None

fields.summary: euca-describe-images does not list all the device mappings

comments.body:
Looks like ec2 suffers from the same problem
{noformat}
[root@swathi-centos ~]# ec2-register -n swathibfebs1 --root-device-name /dev/sda1 --block-device-mapping /dev/sda1=snap-19335b58::false --block-device-mapping /dev/sdb=:2 
IMAGE	ami-5b5dc932

[root@swathi-centos ~]# euca-describe-images ami-5b5dc932
IMAGE	ami-5b5dc932	796679845172/swathibfebs1	796679845172	available	private		i386	machine				ebs
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	/dev/sdb	None	2
{noformat}

\\
However, their API reference and some examples do list all the block device mappings
{noformat}
<PROMPT> ec2-describe-images -F product-code.type=marketplace -o self

IMAGE	ami-1a2b3c4d	111122223333/My MP Image	111122223333	available	private	[marketplace: a1b2c3d4e5f6g7h8i9j10k11]	i386	machine				ebs	paravirtual	xen
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	/dev/sda1	snap-2de0d457	15	standard
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	/dev/sdb	snap-27e0d45d	100	standard
{noformat}

Registered bfebs image with an additional block device mapping, this time using AWS Management Console. And then ec-describe-images displays both (all) the ebs mappings. 

{noformat}
[root@swathi-centos ~]# ec2-describe-images 
IMAGE	ami-c4c85ead	796679845172/bfebs1	796679845172	available	private		i386	machine				ebs	paravirtual	xen
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	EBS	/dev/sda1		snap-3e650f7f	8	true	standard	
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	EBS	/dev/sdb		snap-f54ae0b5	1	true	standard	
{noformat}

\\
Can the behavior for ec2-register be different from aws console registration? Not sure

Seeing duplicates for emi entries when using euca2ools 3.0.0-alpha4-2-geb53794 (Sparta)

{noformat}
[root@g-22-04 clc]# euca-describe-images --debug
